edge: American Hustle is a 2013 American black comedy crime film.
American Hustle is a 2013 American black comedy crime film directed by David O. Russell.
American Hustle was written by Eric Warren Singer and Russell

Christian Bale stars as two con artists forced by an FBI agent (Bradley Cooper) to set up an elaborate sting operation on corrupt politicians, including the mayor of Camden, New Jersey (Jeremy Renner).

American Hustle stars Christian Bale and Amy Adams as two con artists forced by an FBI agent (Bradley Cooper) to set up an elaborate sting operation on corrupt politicians, including the mayor of Camden, New Jersey (Jeremy Renner).

Christian Bale and Amy Adams are forced by an FBI agent (played by Bradley Cooper) to set up an elaborate sting operation on corrupt politicians, including the mayor of Camden, New Jersey (Jeremy Renner).

Christian Bale and Amy Adams are forced by an FBI agent (Bradley Cooper) to set up an elaborate sting operation on corrupt politicians, including the mayor of Camden, New Jersey (played by Jeremy Renner).
American Hustle stars Jennifer Lawrence as the unpredictable wife of Bale's character.
American Hustle was filmed from March to May 2013 in Boston and Worcester, Massachusetts, as well as New York City.
American Hustle was released nationwide in the United States on December 13, 2013.
American Hustle opened to high critical acclaim upon release.
American Hustle emerged as a major commercial success at the box-office, grossing $251 million worldwide on a budget of $40 million.
American Hustle received leading ten nominations at the 86th Academy Awards,
American Hustle received a leading ten nominations at the 86th Academy Awards, including Best Picture,
American Hustle received a leading ten nominations at the 86th Academy Awards, including Best Director (for Russell)
American Hustle received a leading ten nominations at the 86th Academy Awards, including Best Actor (for Bale)
American Hustle received a leading ten nominations at the 86th Academy Awards, including Best Actress (for Adams)
American Hustle received a leading ten nominations at the 86th Academy Awards, including Best Supporting Actor (for Cooper)
American Hustle received a leading ten nominations at the 86th Academy Awards, including Best Supporting Actress (for Lawrence)

In 1978, Irving Rosenfeld and Sydney Prosser work together as con artists. Sydney, posing as English aristocrat 'Lady Edith Greensly', has improved the scams.
Sydney's alias is 'Lady Edith Greensly'.
Irving loves Sydney but is unwilling to leave his unstable, histrionic wife, Rosalyn, fearing he will lose contact with adopted son Danny.
Irving is married to Rosalyn and she has threatened to report him to the police if he leaves her.
FBI agent Richie DiMaso catches Irving and Sydney in a loan scam but offers to release them if Irving can line up four additional arrests.
FBI agent Richie DiMaso catches Irving and Sydney in a loan scam but offers to release them if Irving can line up four additional arrests.
Irving has a friend pretending to be a wealthy Arab sheikh looking for potential investments in America.

The film titled 'American Bullshit' was originally written by Eric Warren Singer and later rewritten by David O. Russell as the highly fictionalized version of the Abscam scandal, titled 'Hustle.'
Eric Warren Singer's screenplay titled 'American Bullshit' was later rewritten by David O. Russell for the film 'Hustle.'
The highly fictionalized version of the Abscam scandal, titled 'Hustle', was created by rewriting Eric Warren Singer's screenplay titled 'American Bullshit' by David O. Russell.
The production of the film, initially titled 'American Bullshit', was set up at Columbia Pictures and produced through Atlas Entertainment.
Initially, Ben Affleck was considered to direct the film titled 'American Bullshit' by Atlas Entertainment and Columbia Pictures before David O. Russell ultimately signed on to helm it.

The film American Hustle was involved in a defamation lawsuit filed by science writer Paul Brodeur against the producers and distributors of the movie, based on a line in the film in which a character claimed that microwave ovens take the nutrition out of food, which Brodeur claims he has never stated in his books about the dangers of microwave radiation.

American Hustle is a dramatization of the FBI's Abscam sting operation in the late 1970s and early '80s that led to convictions of seven members of the United States Congress, among others. The film does not attempt to directly document the events of Abscam.
